001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations.ActivationFunction;
005
006/**
007 * A neuron-like scalar function that combines a {@link LinearCombination}
008 * with a non-linear {@link ActivationFunction}.
009 * <p>
010 * The computation is:
011 * <pre>
012 *   output = activation( bias + Î£ w_i * x_i )
013 * </pre>
014 * where the activation function is applied to the linear combination of inputs.
015 * <p>
016 * Provides parameter gradient calculations that include the effect of the
017 * activation function, making this class suitable for use in neural network
018 * training via backpropagation.
019 */
020@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
021public class NeuronFunction extends LinearCombination {
022
023    private final ActivationFunction activationFunction;
024
025    /**
026     * Creates a new neuron function with the given parameters and activation.
027     * <p>
028     * The parameter array follows the {@link LinearCombination} convention:
029     * index {@code 0} is the bias, indices {@code 1..} are the weights.
030     *
031     * @param parameters         parameter vector (bias + weights)
032     * @param activationFunction the non-linear activation function to apply
033     */
034    public NeuronFunction(float[] parameters, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
035        super(parameters);
036        this.activationFunction = activationFunction;
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * Returns the activation function applied to the weighted sum.
041     *
042     * @return the activation function
043     */
044    public ActivationFunction getActivationFunction() {
045        return activationFunction;
046    }
047
048    /**
049     * Estimates the scalar output by first computing the weighted sum
050     * (via {@link LinearCombination#estimateScalar(float[])})
051     * and then applying the activation function.
052     *
053     * @param inputs the input feature vector
054     * @return the activated scalar output
055     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code inputs.length != arity()}
056     */
057    @Override
058    public float estimateScalar(float[] inputs) {
059        return activationFunction.activate(super.estimateScalar(inputs));
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Calculates the gradients of the output with respect to all parameters,
064     * including the effect of the activation function.
065     * <p>
066     * Concretely:
067     * <ul>
068     *   <li>First calls {@link #calculateParameterGradients_df_dp(float[])}
069     *       to compute gradients of the pre-activation linear function
070     *       (bias + weighted inputs).</li>
071     *   <li>Then multiplies each gradient by the derivative of the activation
072     *       function evaluated at the current output.</li>
073     * </ul>
074     *
075     * @param inputs the input feature vector
076     * @return the gradient vector (bias gradient followed by weight gradients)
077     */
078    public float[] calculateParameterGradients(float[] inputs) {
079        float[] gradients = calculateParameterGradients_df_dp(inputs);
080        float activationGradient = activationFunction.determineGradientForOutput(estimateScalar(inputs));
081        for (int p = 0; p < gradients.length; p++) {
082            gradients[p] *= activationGradient;
083        }
084        return gradients;
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Calculates the parameter gradients of the underlying linear combination
089     * (pre-activation function). This is equivalent to
090     * {@link LinearCombination#calculateParameterGradients(float[])}.
091     *
092     * @param inputs the input feature vector
093     * @return the gradient vector of the linear function
094     */
095    public float[] calculateParameterGradients_df_dp(float[] inputs) {
096        return super.calculateParameterGradients(inputs);
097    }
098
099}
